chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall p q : Z, is_sqr p -> is_sqr q -> is_sqr (Z.mul p q)

Premises:
is_sqr = fun n : Z => 0 <= n /\ (exists i : Z, i * i = n /\ 0 <= i) : Z -> Prop Arguments is_sqr _%Z_scope
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : Z | Zpos : positive -> Z | Zneg : positive -> Z Arguments Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments Zneg _%positive_scope
N.mul = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos q => N.pos (p * q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments N.mul (_ _)%N_scope
is_sqr_sqr : forall n : Z, is_sqr (n * n)
Z.add_lt_mono : forall n m p q : Z, n < m -> p < q -> n + p < m + q
Z.mul_lt_mono_nonpos : forall n m p q : Z, m <= 0 -> n < m -> q <= 0 -> p < q -> m * q < n * p
Z.mul_le_mono_nonpos : forall n m p q : Z, m <= 0 -> n <= m -> q <= 0 -> p <= q -> m * q <= n * p
Z.mul_le_mono_nonneg : forall n m p q : Z, 0 <= n -> n <= m -> 0 <= p -> p <= q -> n * p <= m * q
Z.mul_lt_mono_nonneg : forall n m p q : Z, 0 <= n -> n < m -> 0 <= p -> p < q -> n * p < m * q
Z.add_shuffle1 : forall n m p q : Z, n + m + (p + q) = n + p + (m + q)
Pos.mul_compare_mono_l : forall p q r : positive, (p * q ?= p * r)%positive = (q ?= r)%positive
Z.lt_le_trans : forall n m p : Z, n < m -> m <= p -> n < p
Z.le_lt_trans : forall n m p : Z, n <= m -> m < p -> n < p
Zdivide_intro : forall a b q : Z, b = q * a -> (a | b)
Z.mul_le_mono_nonneg_r : forall n m p : Z, 0 <= p -> n <= m -> n * p <= m * p
Zmult_le_compat_r : forall n m p : Z, n <= m -> 0 <= p -> n * p <= m * p
Z.mul_le_mono_nonneg_l : forall n m p : Z, 0 <= p -> n <= m -> p * n <= p * m
Z.mul_le_mono_nonpos_l : forall n m p : Z, p <= 0 -> n <= m -> p * m <= p * n
Zmult_ge_compat_r : forall n m p : Z, n >= m -> p >= 0 -> n * p >= m * p
Z.mul_lt_mono_neg_r : forall p n m : Z, p < 0 -> n < m < -> m * p < n * p
Z.mul_lt_mono_pos_r : forall p n m : Z, 0 < p -> n < m < -> n * p < m * p
Z.mul_lt_mono_pos_l : forall p n m : Z, 0 < p -> n < m < -> p * n < p * m
Z.mul_le_mono_pos_l : forall n m p : Z, 0 < p -> n <= m < -> p * n <= p * m
Z.mul_le_mono_neg_l : forall n m p : Z, p < 0 -> n <= m < -> p * m <= p * n
ZMicromega.Zdiv_pol_correct : forall (a : Z) (p : RingMicromega.PolC Z), 0 < a -> ZMicromega.Zdivide_pol a p -> forall env : RingMicromega.PolEnv Z, ZMicromega.eval_pol env p = a * ZMicromega.eval_pol env (ZMicromega.Zdiv_pol p a)
Z.mul_divide_mono_l : forall n m p : Z, (n | m) -> (p * n | p * m)
Z.mul_add_distr_r : forall n m p : Z, (n + m) * p = n * p + m * p
Zmult_minus_distr_l : forall n m p : Z, p * (n - m) = p * n - p * m
Z.add_move_l : forall n m p : Z, n + m = p < -> m = p - n
Z.add_cancel_r : forall n m p : Z, n + p = m + p < -> n = m
ZMicromega.Zgcd_pol_div : forall (p : RingMicromega.PolC Z) (g c : Z), ZMicromega.Zgcd_pol p = (g, c) -> ZMicromega.Zdivide_pol g (EnvRing.PsubC Z.sub p c)
ZMicromega.Zgcd_pol_correct_lt : forall (p : RingMicromega.PolC Z) (env : RingMicromega.PolEnv Z) (g c : Z), ZMicromega.Zgcd_pol p = (g, c) -> 0 < g -> ZMicromega.eval_pol env p = g * ZMicromega.eval_pol env (ZMicromega.Zdiv_pol (EnvRing.PsubC Z.sub p c) g) + c
ZMicromega.Zdiv_pol = fix Zdiv_pol (p : RingMicromega.PolC Z) (x : Z) {struct p} : RingMicromega.PolC Z := match p with | EnvRing.Pc c => EnvRing.Pc (c / x) | EnvRing.Pinj j p0 => EnvRing.Pinj j (Zdiv_pol p0 x) | EnvRing.PX p0 j q => EnvRing.PX (Zdiv_pol p0 x) j (Zdiv_pol q x) end : RingMicromega.PolC Z -> Z -> RingMicromega.PolC Z Arguments ZMicromega.Zdiv_pol _ _%Z_scope
